1: The retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) is sensitive to hypervitaminosis A
2: Sodium is found in higher concentration in the tear than in the serum
3: The corneal stroma measures 500 um thick
4: The following protein is found in the tear of a normal person have antibacterial activity;lysozyme
5: The corneal stroma derives most of its oxygen from the precorneal tear film
6: ERG is normal in patient with macular degeneration
7: In electro-retinography, c-wave is produced by the RPE cells
8: The retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) has multiple apical villi into which the outer segment of the photoreceptor outer segments are embedded.
9: The corneal stroma is acellular which accounts for its transparency
10: The corneal stroma contains collagen fibrils which forms obliquely oriented lamellae in the posterior third of the cornea
